result.execSummary:
The defendant David E. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.
  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.
  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  No THC.
  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
**  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
**  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
  Probation & Parole to notify the court, in writing, of upon dirty UA or proof of possession/ consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David E. Brown

records.addlTxt: Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk. M.Burke. Agent Genoa Cole appears by zoom. Agent Cole states that the DE's lasted UA was negative and has another appointment with him in 2 weeks. Court imposes and stays 7 days jail. If the next UA comes back positive the stay will be lifted. Court takes no action at this time.
Review hearing on August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
A RH has been set to 08/24/22 at 1:30 with Agent Cole. Attorney Celebre advised that his responsibilites with this case were concluded. SPD advised of hearing.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.    Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Celebre.  Clerk. M.Burke. State filed an amended informtion. Attorney Celebre acknowledges receipt and waives reading. DE pleads guilty. Court finds DE guilty. Court withholds sentence and places DE on probation for 1 year with conditions; DE to submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge.

Defendant, David E. Brown, appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.  Attorney James Steven Kraus appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:    DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over to Br 2.  Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Branch 2 Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

01:41 - 01:42 PM    State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney David Celebre.  Clerk: P. Pfeuffer.  Preliminary Hearing set on March 18, 2022 at 09:30 am. before Comm , 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI.  Bond continued as previously set.  ts
David Celebre appointed as advocate counsel; deft to pay $50/mo commencing 4/1/22.
Proposed Order forwarded to JA/ Judge

Status conference scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.
